title: Add integration tests for flat self-hosting workflow
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.1-uc005-flat-self-hosting.yaml (test cases: init, create, list, get, update, delete, end-to-end workflows, persistence)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc005-flat-self-hosting.yaml (S1-S10 success criteria)
- tests/integration/test_rel01_1_uc004_generic_table_cli_test.go (after task 2 — CLI test patterns)

## Files to Create/Modify
- tests/integration/test_rel01_1_uc005_flat_self_hosting_test.go (create)

## Requirements
- Test full issue-tracking workflow using only generic table commands:
  - Initialize cupboard (S1)
  - Create crumb with set (S2)
  - List all crumbs (S3)
  - List with State=draft filter (S4)
  - Update state to taken (S5)
  - Update state to pebble/close (S6)
  - Get crumb details (S7)
  - Do-work cycle: create -> list draft -> claim (taken) -> close (pebble) (S8)
  - Make-work cycle: list existing -> create multiple new crumbs (S9)
  - JSONL persistence survives database deletion (S10)
- Use os/exec to run cupboard binary
- Parse JSON output to extract CrumbIDs for subsequent operations

## Design Decisions
- Tests mirror the do-work.sh and make-work.sh workflow patterns
- Each end-to-end test runs the full sequence in a single temp directory
- JSON parsing with encoding/json for output verification
- Reuse runCupboard helper from generic table CLI tests if in same package

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 10 success criteria (S1-S10) have test coverage
- [ ] Do-work cycle test runs full create -> claim -> close workflow
- [ ] Make-work cycle test creates multiple crumbs and verifies count
- [ ] JSONL persistence test deletes .db file and verifies data survives
- [ ] Tests pass with `go test ./tests/integration/... -run TestFlatSelfHosting`

title: Implement config.yaml loading with Viper
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd010-configuration-directories.yaml (R7 config.yaml, R8 precedence)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc003-configuration-loading.yaml (F4 load config.yaml, F6 create on first run, S6-S8)
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (existing flag handling)
- internal/paths/paths.go (after task 3 — ResolveConfigDir)

## Files to Create/Modify
- cmd/cupboard/config.go (create) — Viper-based config loading
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (modify) — integrate config loading into PersistentPreRunE

## Requirements
- Load config.yaml from resolved config directory using Viper
- Config file fields: backend (string, default "sqlite"), data_dir (string, optional)
- Create config directory on first run if it does not exist
- Create default config.yaml on first run if config dir exists but file does not
- Missing config.yaml is not an error (use defaults)
- Integrate into root command's PersistentPreRunE so all subcommands benefit
- Pass resolved data_dir from config.yaml to resolveDataDir pipeline

## Design Decisions
- Use spf13/viper for config file parsing (per go-style standard ecosystem)
- Config loading happens once in PersistentPreRunE, not per-command
- Keep it minimal: only load data_dir and backend from config.yaml

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] config.yaml is loaded from resolved config directory
- [ ] data_dir from config.yaml is respected when no --data-dir flag provided
- [ ] Missing config.yaml uses defaults without error
- [ ] Config directory created on first run if absent
- [ ] Default config.yaml created on first run if absent
- [ ] PersistentPreRunE integrates config loading for all commands

title: Define Config struct, Cupboard interface, and Table interface in pkg/types
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (R1-R3, R7-R8)
- docs/ARCHITECTURE.md § Main Interface, § Design Decisions

## Files to Create/Modify
- pkg/types/config.go (create) - Config struct with Backend, DataDir fields; config validation errors (ErrBackendEmpty, ErrBackendUnknown, ErrSyncStrategyUnknown, ErrBatchSizeInvalid, ErrBatchIntervalInvalid); Validate() method
- pkg/types/cupboard.go (create) - Cupboard interface with GetTable, Attach, Detach; standard table name constants; cupboard lifecycle errors (ErrCupboardDetached, ErrAlreadyAttached, ErrTableNotFound)
- pkg/types/table.go (create) - Table interface with Get, Set, Delete, Fetch; table operation errors (ErrNotFound, ErrInvalidID, ErrInvalidData, ErrInvalidFilter); Filter type alias

## Requirements
- Config struct with Backend (string) and DataDir (string) fields per prd001 R1
- Config.Validate() checks Backend not empty, Backend recognized, DataDir not empty when Backend is "sqlite"
- Cupboard interface: GetTable(name string) (Table, error), Attach(config Config) error, Detach() error
- Table interface: Get(id string) (any, error), Set(id string, data any) (string, error), Delete(id string) error, Fetch(filter map[string]any) ([]any, error)
- Standard table name constants: crumbs, trails, properties, metadata, links, stashes
- All sentinel errors defined per prd001 R7 with errors.New
- Filter type alias: type Filter = map[string]any

## Design Decisions
- Interfaces in pkg/types (shared contract layer); implementations in internal/
- Config struct, not interface, for serialization compatibility
- Sentinel errors for errors.Is compatibility

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Config struct compiles with Backend and DataDir fields
- [ ] Config.Validate() returns correct errors for empty/unknown backend, empty DataDir
- [ ] Cupboard interface compiles with GetTable, Attach, Detach
- [ ] Table interface compiles with Get, Set, Delete, Fetch
- [ ] All 6 standard table name constants defined
- [ ] All sentinel errors from prd001 R7.1-R7.3 defined
- [ ] go build ./pkg/types succeeds

title: Unit tests for pkg/types: Config, Crumb, Trail entity methods
description:
## Required Reading
- pkg/types/config.go (Config struct, Validate)
- pkg/types/crumb.go (Crumb struct, state methods, property methods)
- pkg/types/trail.go (Trail struct, Complete, Abandon)
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.0-uc001-cupboard-lifecycle.yaml (config validation test cases)
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.0-uc003-crumb-lifecycle.yaml (state transition test cases)

## Files to Create/Modify
- pkg/types/config_test.go (create) - Table-driven tests for Config.Validate: valid config, empty backend, unknown backend, empty DataDir for sqlite
- pkg/types/crumb_test.go (create) - Table-driven tests for SetState (valid states, invalid state, idempotent), Pebble (from taken OK, from other states fails), Dust (from any state OK, idempotent), property methods (SetProperty, GetProperty, ClearProperty)
- pkg/types/trail_test.go (create) - Table-driven tests for Complete (from active OK, from other states fails), Abandon (from active OK, from other states fails)

## Requirements
- Use testify/assert for assertions
- Table-driven tests: each YAML test case maps to one row
- Test edge cases: zero values, nil Properties map, empty strings
- Test all error conditions return correct sentinel errors

## Design Decisions
- Tests in pkg/types package (white-box testing of entity methods)
- Use testify for readable assertions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Config validation tests cover all error paths
- [ ] Crumb state transition tests cover all valid/invalid transitions
- [ ] Crumb property method tests cover set/get/clear/not-found
- [ ] Trail lifecycle tests cover Complete and Abandon
- [ ] All tests pass: go test ./pkg/types/...
- [ ] No test uses hardcoded UUIDs (generate or use constants)

title: Define SQLite backend configuration and constructor in internal/sqlite
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-sqlite-backend.yaml (R1 directory layout, R4 startup, R16 sync strategy)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (R1 Config, R4 Attach)
- pkg/types/config.go (Config struct)
- pkg/types/cupboard.go (Cupboard interface)

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/sqlite/backend.go (create) - SQLiteBackend struct implementing Cupboard interface; SQLiteConfig struct with SyncStrategy, BatchSize, BatchInterval; NewBackend() constructor; GetTable, Attach, Detach method stubs; attached/detached state tracking
- internal/sqlite/schema.go (create) - SQL schema DDL strings (all 9 CREATE TABLE statements, all 12 CREATE INDEX statements from prd002 R3)

## Requirements
- SQLiteBackend struct with: db connection, attached flag, mutex for state, map of table accessors, config
- NewBackend() returns *SQLiteBackend (not attached)
- Attach(config): validate config, create DataDir if needed, create empty JSONL files if needed, delete existing cupboard.db, create new cupboard.db with schema, mark as attached; return ErrAlreadyAttached if already attached
- Detach(): mark as detached, close db; idempotent
- GetTable(name): return table accessor from map or ErrTableNotFound; return ErrCupboardDetached if detached
- Schema DDL as const strings per prd002 R3.2 and R3.3

## Design Decisions
- Use modernc.org/sqlite (pure Go, no CGO) per architecture doc
- Single backend.go for the struct and lifecycle; schema.go for DDL constants
- Table accessors created during Attach and cached

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SQLiteBackend implements Cupboard interface (compile check)
- [ ] NewBackend returns unattached backend
- [ ] Attach creates DataDir and JSONL files
- [ ] Attach creates cupboard.db with correct schema
- [ ] Detach closes connection and marks detached
- [ ] GetTable returns ErrTableNotFound for unknown names
- [ ] GetTable returns ErrCupboardDetached after Detach
- [ ] go build ./internal/sqlite succeeds

title: Implement metadata, stashes table accessors and JSONL loading
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd005-metadata-interface.yaml (Metadata entity, schemas)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd008-stash-interface.yaml (Stash entity, history, operations)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-sqlite-backend.yaml (R4 startup sequence, R9 built-in properties seeding)
- internal/sqlite/backend.go (Attach method)

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/sqlite/metadata_table.go (create) - metadataTable implementing Table; Fetch supports filter by table_name, crumb_id, property_id, content_contains, limit, offset
- internal/sqlite/stashes_table.go (create) - stashesTable implementing Table; Set handles version increment and history append to stash_history; stash_history JSONL persistence
- internal/sqlite/loader.go (create) - JSONL loading functions for startup: loadAllJSONL reads each JSONL file and inserts into SQLite tables; seedBuiltInProperties creates priority/type/description/owner/labels properties and categories if properties.jsonl is empty per prd002 R9
- internal/sqlite/backend.go (modify) - Wire Attach to call loader, create all 6 table accessors, store in map

## Requirements
- metadataTable: hydrate/dehydrate Metadata per prd002 R14.5; Fetch with schema name, crumb_id, content_contains filters
- stashesTable: hydrate/dehydrate Stash per prd002 R14.7; Set increments Version, records StashHistoryEntry, persists to stashes.jsonl and stash_history.jsonl
- Loader: read each JSONL file line by line, parse JSON, insert into SQLite; skip malformed lines with warning; seed built-in properties per prd002 R9
- Wire all 6 table accessors into backend.Attach

## Design Decisions
- Stash history append-only: never rewrite stash_history.jsonl, only append
- Built-in properties seeded only if properties.jsonl is empty (first run)
- Loader is transactional per prd002 R4.4

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] metadataTable implements Table with filtering
- [ ] stashesTable implements Table with version/history tracking
- [ ] Loader reads JSONL files into SQLite on Attach
- [ ] Built-in properties seeded on first startup
- [ ] Attach creates all 6 table accessors
- [ ] go build ./internal/sqlite succeeds

title: Add integration tests for configuration loading precedence
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.1-uc003-configuration-loading.yaml (test cases)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc003-configuration-loading.yaml (S1-S9 success criteria)
- internal/paths/paths.go (path resolution functions)
- cmd/cupboard/config.go (config loading)

## Files to Create/Modify
- tests/integration/test_rel01_1_uc003_configuration_loading_test.go (create)

## Requirements
- Test platform default paths return expected values (S1)
- Test CRUMBS_CONFIG_DIR env overrides config directory (S2)
- Test CRUMBS_DATA_DIR env overrides data directory (S3)
- Test --config-dir flag overrides env and default (S4)
- Test --data-dir flag overrides config.yaml and default (S5)
- Test missing config.yaml uses defaults without error (S6)
- Test config.yaml data_dir is respected when no flag (S7)
- Test config directory created on first run (S8)
- Test commands work with each override method (S9)
- Use os/exec to run cupboard binary with various flag/env combinations
- Use temp directories for isolation

## Design Decisions
- Set env vars with t.Setenv for automatic cleanup
- Each test case creates its own temp directory
- Write config.yaml to temp dir for config file tests

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 9 success criteria (S1-S9) have test coverage
- [ ] Tests use table-driven pattern where applicable
- [ ] Tests pass on macOS (current platform)
- [ ] Each test is independent and uses isolated temp dirs

title: Extract shared CLI helpers: parseEntityJSON to helpers.go
description:
## Required Reading
- cmd/cupboard/helpers.go (existing attachBackend, validTableNames, error checkers)
- cmd/cupboard/set.go (parseEntityJSON currently lives here)
- cmd/cupboard/get.go, list.go, delete.go (verify no other duplicated patterns)
- pkg/types/cupboard.go (standard table name constants)
- pkg/types/*.go (all entity structs)

## Files to Create/Modify
- cmd/cupboard/helpers.go (modify) — move parseEntityJSON here
- cmd/cupboard/set.go (modify) — remove parseEntityJSON, use from helpers

## Requirements
- Move `parseEntityJSON(tableName string, data []byte) (any, error)` from set.go to helpers.go
- Verify no other duplicated logic exists across the four command files (get, set, list, delete)
- Follow go-style rule: no duplicated code, extract when pattern appears twice

## Design Decisions
- helpers.go already contains attachBackend, validTableNames, and error checkers
- parseEntityJSON is only used by set.go today but belongs in shared helpers for future reuse

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] parseEntityJSON lives in helpers.go
- [ ] set.go imports it from helpers (same package, no import needed)
- [ ] All four commands (get, set, list, delete) use shared helpers where applicable
- [ ] `go build ./cmd/cupboard` succeeds
- [ ] All existing tests still pass

title: Wire CLI with cobra: init and version commands using Cupboard
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd009-cupboard-cli.yaml (init, version commands)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd010-configuration-directories.yaml (config/data directory defaults)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.0-uc004-scaffolding-validation.yaml (CLI version, tables accessible)
- cmd/cupboard/main.go (existing entry point)
- pkg/crumbs/version.go (version constant)

## Files to Create/Modify
- cmd/cupboard/main.go (modify) - Replace print-only main with cobra root command
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (create) - Root cobra command with --config-dir, --data-dir, --json global flags
- cmd/cupboard/init.go (create) - Init command: creates data directory, initializes backend (Attach + Detach), seeds built-in properties
- cmd/cupboard/version.go (create) - Version command: prints version string

## Requirements
- Root command "cupboard" with persistent flags: --config-dir, --data-dir, --json, --help, --version
- "cupboard init" creates .crumbs-db directory (or custom data-dir), calls Attach to initialize backend and JSONL files, then Detach
- "cupboard version" prints version string from pkg/crumbs/version.go
- Exit codes: 0 success, 1 user error, 2 system error per prd009
- Config/data directory defaults per prd010: $(CWD)/.crumbs for config, $(CWD)/.crumbs-db for data

## Design Decisions
- Use cobra for CLI framework per go-style rule
- Minimal CLI: only init and version for release 01.0
- Wire real SQLiteBackend in init command

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] cupboard version prints version and exits 0
- [ ] cupboard init creates data directory with JSONL files
- [ ] cupboard init seeds built-in properties
- [ ] cupboard --help shows available commands
- [ ] go build ./cmd/cupboard succeeds
- [ ] go install ./cmd/cupboard succeeds

title: Add integration tests for generic table CLI commands
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.1-uc004-generic-table-cli.yaml (test cases to implement)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc004-generic-table-cli.yaml (success criteria S1-S12)
- tests/integration/test_rel01_0_uc001_cupboard_lifecycle_test.go (existing test patterns)
- tests/integration/test_rel01_0_uc002_table_crud_test.go (existing test patterns)
- cmd/cupboard/get.go, set.go, list.go, delete.go (commands under test)

## Files to Create/Modify
- tests/integration/test_rel01_1_uc004_generic_table_cli_test.go (create) — CLI integration tests

## Requirements
- Implement table-driven tests exercising the cupboard CLI binary via os/exec
- Build cupboard binary in TestMain or test setup, use temp directory for data
- Test cases per test suite YAML:
  - Get: valid entity returns JSON (S1), missing entity exit 1 (S2), unknown table exit 1 with valid names (S3)
  - Set: create with empty ID returns JSON with generated ID (S4), update with existing ID (S5), invalid JSON exit 1 (S6)
  - List: all entities returns JSON array (S7), with State=draft filter (S8), invalid filter exit 1 (S9)
  - Delete: removes entity prints confirmation (S10), missing entity exit 1 (S11)
  - Cross-table: commands work for crumbs, trails, links (S12)
- Each test case uses a fresh cupboard init in a temp directory

## Design Decisions
- Use os/exec.Command to run the built binary (true CLI integration test)
- Build binary once in TestMain, store path in package-level var
- Helper: runCupboard(t, args...) (stdout, stderr, exitCode) for clean test assertions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 12 success criteria (S1-S12) have at least one test case
- [ ] Tests use table-driven pattern
- [ ] Tests build and run the cupboard binary via os/exec
- [ ] Tests pass with `go test ./tests/integration/... -run TestGenericTableCLI`
- [ ] Each test case is independent (uses its own temp directory)

title: Implement generic table CLI get command
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd009-cupboard-cli.yaml (R3.1 get command specification)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (R2 Cupboard interface, R3 Table interface)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc004-generic-table-cli.yaml (S1-S3 success criteria for get)
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (existing CLI structure, global flags, resolveDataDir helper)
- cmd/cupboard/init.go (pattern for backend initialization)
- internal/sqlite/backend.go (NewBackend, Attach, GetTable)

## Files to Create/Modify
- cmd/cupboard/get.go (create) — get command implementation
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (modify) — register get command

## Requirements
- Implement `cupboard get <table> <id>` per prd009-cupboard-cli R3.1
- Accept table name and entity ID as positional arguments (cobra.ExactArgs(2))
- Resolve data dir, create backend, attach, get table, call Table.Get(id)
- Output JSON object with 2-space indentation per R7.3
- Exit 1 with "unknown table" message listing valid names if table not found
- Exit 1 with "entity not found" message if entity not found
- Exit 2 for system errors (backend initialization failures)
- Error messages to stderr per R7.4

## Design Decisions
- Extract a shared helper function `attachBackend()` that resolves data dir, creates backend, and attaches — reuse across get/set/list/delete commands. Place in cmd/cupboard/helpers.go or inline in a shared file.
- Use json.MarshalIndent for output formatting
- Entity returned as `any` from Table.Get — marshal directly to JSON

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `cupboard get crumbs <valid-id>` returns JSON with exit 0
- [ ] `cupboard get crumbs <nonexistent-id>` returns exit 1 with not-found message
- [ ] `cupboard get unknown-table <id>` returns exit 1 with valid table names
- [ ] Error messages written to stderr
- [ ] JSON output uses 2-space indentation
- [ ] Command registered in root.go init()

title: Add init command --config-dir support and config directory creation
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd010-configuration-directories.yaml (R1.2, R1.6 config directory creation)

- cmd/cupboard/root.go (global flags)
- internal/paths/paths.go (after task 3 — path resolution)

## Files to Create/Modify

## Requirements
- When `cupboard init` runs, also create the config directory (resolved via --config-dir > env > default)
- Create default config.yaml in config directory if it does not exist
- Print both config and data directory paths on successful init
- Integrate with internal/paths.ResolveConfigDir

## Design Decisions
- init already creates the data directory; extend it to also create config directory
- Use os.MkdirAll for idempotent directory creation
- Default config.yaml contains only backend: sqlite

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `cupboard init` creates config directory
- [ ] `cupboard init` creates default config.yaml with backend: sqlite
- [ ] `cupboard init --config-dir=/tmp/cfg` uses specified config directory
- [ ] Existing data directory creation still works
- [ ] `go build ./cmd/cupboard` succeeds

title: Implement crumbs table accessor with Get, Set, Delete, Fetch
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-sqlite-backend.yaml (R12-R15 table routing, interface impl, hydration, persistence)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd003-crumbs-interface.yaml (R3 creation, R6-R10 retrieval/update/delete/filter/query)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (R3 Table interface, R8 UUID v7)
- internal/sqlite/backend.go (SQLiteBackend, schema)
- pkg/types/crumb.go (Crumb struct)

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/sqlite/crumbs_table.go (create) - crumbsTable struct implementing Table interface; Get (query by ID, hydrate to *Crumb), Set (create with UUID v7 if empty ID, update if exists; validate Name non-empty; dehydrate to SQL), Delete (remove crumb + cascade property values/metadata/links), Fetch (build WHERE from filter map, hydrate results)
- internal/sqlite/jsonl.go (create) - JSONL read/write helpers: readJSONL(path) ([]json.RawMessage, error), writeJSONL(path, records) with atomic write pattern (temp file, fsync, rename); loadCrumbsJSONL, persistCrumbsJSONL

## Requirements
- crumbsTable.Get: query crumbs table by crumb_id, hydrate row to *Crumb per prd002 R14.2, return ErrNotFound/ErrInvalidID
- crumbsTable.Set: type-assert data to *Crumb, validate Name non-empty (ErrInvalidName), generate UUID v7 if CrumbID empty, set CreatedAt/UpdatedAt/State=draft on create, INSERT or UPDATE, persist to crumbs.jsonl atomically
- crumbsTable.Delete: delete from crumbs table + cascade (crumb_properties, metadata, links where from_id or to_id), persist affected JSONL files, return ErrNotFound/ErrInvalidID
- crumbsTable.Fetch: support filters (states, trail_id, parent_id, limit, offset), order by created_at DESC, return []any of *Crumb
- JSONL helpers: atomic write (write temp, fsync, rename), read line-by-line skipping empty/malformed
- UUID v7 generation using google/uuid package

## Design Decisions
- Each table accessor owns its JSONL persistence
- Atomic write pattern per prd002 R5.2
- Filter keys map to SQL WHERE clauses; trail_id and parent_id require JOIN on links table

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] crumbsTable implements Table interface
- [ ] Get returns hydrated *Crumb or ErrNotFound
- [ ] Set creates crumb with UUID v7 and correct defaults
- [ ] Set updates existing crumb
- [ ] Delete cascades to properties, metadata, links
- [ ] Fetch with empty filter returns all crumbs
- [ ] Fetch respects states, limit, offset filters
- [ ] JSONL atomic write pattern works (temp, fsync, rename)
- [ ] go build ./internal/sqlite succeeds

title: Implement configuration loading with platform defaults and precedence chain
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd010-configuration-directories.yaml (R1-R2 directory structure, R8 precedence)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc003-configuration-loading.yaml (flow F1-F7, success criteria S1-S9)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd009-cupboard-cli.yaml (R6 global flags)
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (existing resolveDataDir, global flags)

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/paths/paths.go (create) — platform-specific default paths and resolution functions
- internal/paths/paths_test.go (create) — unit tests for path resolution
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (modify) — replace resolveDataDir with paths.ResolveDataDir, add resolveConfigDir

## Requirements
- Implement DefaultConfigDir() and DefaultDataDir() per prd010 R1.2 and R2.2:
  - Linux: XDG_CONFIG_HOME/crumbs and XDG_DATA_HOME/crumbs (fallback ~/.config/crumbs and ~/.local/share/crumbs)
  - macOS: ~/Library/Application Support/crumbs (both config and data)
  - Windows: %APPDATA%/crumbs (both config and data)
- Implement ResolveConfigDir(flag, env string) string: flag > CRUMBS_CONFIG_DIR env > DefaultConfigDir()
- Implement ResolveDataDir(flag, configYAMLValue, env string) string: flag > config.yaml data_dir > CRUMBS_DATA_DIR env > DefaultDataDir()
- For CWD-relative defaults: when --data-dir is empty and no config or env override, use $(CWD)/.crumbs-db (current behavior preserved)

## Design Decisions
- Use runtime.GOOS for platform detection
- Use os.UserHomeDir() and os.UserConfigDir() for cross-platform home paths
- Keep CWD-relative defaults as the primary mode (matching current behavior)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] DefaultConfigDir returns correct path per platform
- [ ] DefaultDataDir returns correct path per platform
- [ ] ResolveConfigDir follows flag > env > default precedence
- [ ] ResolveDataDir follows flag > config > env > default precedence
- [ ] Unit tests verify each precedence level
- [ ] root.go resolveDataDir uses the new paths package

title: Implement generic table CLI list command
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd009-cupboard-cli.yaml (R3.4 list command specification)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (R3 Table interface, Filter type)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc004-generic-table-cli.yaml (S7-S9 success criteria for list)
- cmd/cupboard/get.go (pattern from get command, shared helpers)
- internal/sqlite/crumbs_table.go (Fetch filter keys: states, trail_id, parent_id, limit, offset)

## Files to Create/Modify
- cmd/cupboard/list.go (create) — list command implementation
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (modify) — register list command

## Requirements
- Implement `cupboard list <table> [key=value...]` per prd009-cupboard-cli R3.4
- Accept table name as first arg, remaining args as key=value filter pairs
- Parse filters: split on '=' to get key and value; exit 1 for malformed filters
- Special handling: if key is "states" or "State", wrap value in []string for the filter map
- Call Table.Fetch(filter) and output JSON array with 2-space indentation
- Empty results output `[]` (not null)
- Exit 1 with "unknown table" for invalid table, exit 1 with "invalid filter" for bad syntax

## Design Decisions
- Filters passed as positional args after table name (not flags) for simplicity
- The filter map is passed directly to Table.Fetch — each table implementation handles its own filter keys

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `cupboard list crumbs` returns JSON array of all crumbs
- [ ] `cupboard list crumbs State=draft` returns filtered results
- [ ] `cupboard list crumbs` on empty table returns `[]`
- [ ] `cupboard list crumbs bad-filter` returns exit 1 with expected format message
- [ ] `cupboard list unknown-table` returns exit 1 with valid table names
- [ ] Command registered in root.go init()

title: Add integration tests for flat self-hosting workflow
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.1-uc005-flat-self-hosting.yaml (test cases: init, create, list, get, update, delete, end-to-end workflows, persistence)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc005-flat-self-hosting.yaml (S1-S10 success criteria)
- tests/integration/test_rel01_1_uc004_generic_table_cli_test.go (after task 5 — CLI test patterns)

## Files to Create/Modify
- tests/integration/test_rel01_1_uc005_flat_self_hosting_test.go (create)

## Requirements
- Test full issue-tracking workflow using only generic table commands:
  - Initialize cupboard (S1)
  - Create crumb with set (S2)
  - List all crumbs (S3)
  - List with State=draft filter (S4)
  - Update state to taken (S5)
  - Update state to pebble/close (S6)
  - Get crumb details (S7)
  - Do-work cycle: create → list draft → claim (taken) → close (pebble) (S8)
  - Make-work cycle: list existing → create multiple new crumbs (S9)
  - JSONL persistence survives database deletion (S10)
- Use os/exec to run cupboard binary
- Parse JSON output to extract CrumbIDs for subsequent operations

## Design Decisions
- Tests mirror the do-work.sh and make-work.sh workflow patterns
- Each end-to-end test runs the full sequence in a single temp directory
- JSON parsing with encoding/json for output verification

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 10 success criteria (S1-S10) have test coverage
- [ ] Do-work cycle test runs full create → claim → close workflow
- [ ] Make-work cycle test creates multiple crumbs and verifies count
- [ ] JSONL persistence test deletes .db file and verifies data survives
- [ ] Tests pass with `go test ./tests/integration/... -run TestFlatSelfHosting`

title: Define Crumb property methods and remaining entity structs in pkg/types
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd003-crumbs-interface.yaml (R5 property methods)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd006-trails-interface.yaml (Trail struct)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd004-properties-interface.yaml (Property and Category structs)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd005-metadata-interface.yaml (Metadata struct)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd007-links-interface.yaml (Link struct)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd008-stash-interface.yaml (Stash struct)
- pkg/types/crumb.go (existing Crumb struct)

## Files to Create/Modify
- pkg/types/crumb.go (modify) - Add property methods: SetProperty, GetProperty, GetProperties, ClearProperty
- pkg/types/trail.go (create) - Trail struct with ID, State, CreatedAt, CompletedAt; Complete() and Abandon() methods
- pkg/types/property.go (create) - Property struct, Category struct, value type constants, built-in property names
- pkg/types/metadata.go (create) - Metadata struct, Schema struct, built-in schema constants
- pkg/types/link.go (create) - Link struct, link type constants (belongs_to, child_of, branches_from, scoped_to)
- pkg/types/stash.go (create) - Stash struct, StashHistoryEntry struct, stash type constants, stash methods
- pkg/types/errors.go (create) - Entity-specific errors not already in table.go (ErrInvalidState, ErrInvalidTransition, ErrInvalidName, ErrPropertyNotFound, ErrTypeMismatch, ErrInvalidCategory, etc.)

## Requirements
- Crumb property methods per prd003 R5: SetProperty, GetProperty, GetProperties, ClearProperty
- Trail struct per prd006: TrailID, State, CreatedAt, CompletedAt (*time.Time); Complete(), Abandon() methods
- Property and Category structs per prd004
- Metadata struct per prd005
- Link struct with link type constants per prd007
- Stash and StashHistoryEntry structs per prd008
- All entity-specific sentinel errors from prd001 R7.3

## Design Decisions
- Keep entity errors centralized in errors.go for discoverability
- Property methods on Crumb do basic checks (key exists in map); full validation deferred to Table.Set
- Trail.Complete requires active state; Trail.Abandon requires active state per prd006

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Crumb property methods compile and modify Properties map
- [ ] Trail struct with lifecycle methods compiles
- [ ] Property, Category, Metadata, Link, Stash structs all compile with correct fields
- [ ] All entity-specific errors defined
- [ ] go build ./pkg/types succeeds

title: Define Crumb entity struct and state transition methods in pkg/types
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd003-crumbs-interface.yaml (R1, R2, R4)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (R7.3 for entity method errors)
- pkg/types/table.go (error types already defined)

## Files to Create/Modify
- pkg/types/crumb.go (create) - Crumb struct, state constants, state transition methods

## Requirements
- Crumb struct: CrumbID (string), Name (string), State (string), CreatedAt (time.Time), UpdatedAt (time.Time), Properties (map[string]any)
- State constants: draft, pending, ready, taken, pebble, dust
- Valid states set for validation
- SetState(state string) error: validates state is valid, updates State and UpdatedAt; idempotent; returns ErrInvalidState for invalid state
- Pebble() error: requires current state is "taken", sets State to pebble, updates UpdatedAt; returns ErrInvalidTransition otherwise
- Dust() error: sets State to dust from any state, updates UpdatedAt; idempotent

## Design Decisions
- State as string (not Go enum) for JSON compatibility per prd003 R2.4
- Entity methods modify struct in memory; caller calls Table.Set to persist
- Use a validStates map for O(1) lookup

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Crumb struct has all 6 fields per prd003 R1.1
- [ ] 6 state constants defined
- [ ] SetState validates and transitions correctly
- [ ] Pebble requires "taken" state, returns ErrInvalidTransition otherwise
- [ ] Dust works from any state, is idempotent
- [ ] All methods update UpdatedAt
- [ ] go build ./pkg/types succeeds

title: Implement trails, links, and properties table accessors
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-sqlite-backend.yaml (R5.5-R5.7 trail cascade, R12 table routing)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd006-trails-interface.yaml (Trail entity)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd007-links-interface.yaml (Link entity, types, uniqueness)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd004-properties-interface.yaml (Property, Category entities)
- internal/sqlite/crumbs_table.go (existing pattern)
- internal/sqlite/jsonl.go (JSONL helpers)

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/sqlite/trails_table.go (create) - trailsTable implementing Table; Get, Set (with cascade on state change: completed removes belongs_to links, abandoned cascades crumb deletion), Delete, Fetch
- internal/sqlite/links_table.go (create) - linksTable implementing Table; Get, Set (validate uniqueness constraint link_type+from_id+to_id), Delete, Fetch (filter by link_type, from_id, to_id)
- internal/sqlite/properties_table.go (create) - propertiesTable implementing Table; Get, Set (with backfill: creating property seeds defaults for all existing crumbs), Delete, Fetch

## Requirements
- trailsTable: hydrate/dehydrate Trail per prd002 R14.3; Set detects state change to completed (remove belongs_to links) or abandoned (cascade delete crumbs + their properties/metadata/links) per prd002 R5.6-R5.7
- linksTable: hydrate/dehydrate Link per prd002 R14.6; Set validates uniqueness of (link_type, from_id, to_id); Fetch supports filter by link_type, from_id, to_id
- propertiesTable: hydrate/dehydrate Property per prd002 R14.4; Set triggers backfill of crumb_properties for all existing crumbs when creating a new property
- Each table persists to its JSONL file atomically

## Design Decisions
- Trail cascade runs inside the same SQLite transaction as the state update
- Link uniqueness enforced at SQL level (UNIQUE constraint) and returned as appropriate error
- Property backfill queries all crumbs and inserts default property values

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] trailsTable implements Table; cascade on completed/abandoned works
- [ ] linksTable implements Table; uniqueness enforced
- [ ] propertiesTable implements Table; backfill on creation works
- [ ] All tables persist to JSONL atomically
- [ ] go build ./internal/sqlite succeeds

title: Implement configuration loading with platform defaults and precedence chain
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd010-configuration-directories.yaml (R1-R2 directory structure, R8 precedence)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc003-configuration-loading.yaml (flow F1-F7, success criteria S1-S9)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd009-cupboard-cli.yaml (R6 global flags)
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (existing resolveDataDir, global flags)

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/paths/paths.go (create) — platform-specific default paths and resolution functions
- internal/paths/paths_test.go (create) — unit tests for path resolution
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (modify) — replace resolveDataDir with paths.ResolveDataDir, add resolveConfigDir

## Requirements
- Implement DefaultConfigDir() and DefaultDataDir() per prd010 R1.2 and R2.2:
  - Linux: XDG_CONFIG_HOME/crumbs and XDG_DATA_HOME/crumbs (fallback ~/.config/crumbs and ~/.local/share/crumbs)
  - macOS: ~/Library/Application Support/crumbs (both config and data)
  - Windows: %APPDATA%/crumbs (both config and data)
- Implement ResolveConfigDir(flag, env string) string: flag > CRUMBS_CONFIG_DIR env > DefaultConfigDir()
- Implement ResolveDataDir(flag, configYAMLValue, env string) string: flag > config.yaml data_dir > CRUMBS_DATA_DIR env > DefaultDataDir()
- For CWD-relative defaults: when --data-dir is empty and no config or env override, use $(CWD)/.crumbs-db (current behavior preserved)

## Design Decisions
- Use runtime.GOOS for platform detection
- Use os.UserHomeDir() and os.UserConfigDir() for cross-platform home paths
- Keep CWD-relative defaults as the primary mode (matching current behavior); platform defaults are used only when env/flag overrides are provided

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] DefaultConfigDir returns correct path per platform
- [ ] DefaultDataDir returns correct path per platform
- [ ] ResolveConfigDir follows flag > env > default precedence
- [ ] ResolveDataDir follows flag > config > env > default precedence
- [ ] Unit tests verify each precedence level
- [ ] root.go resolveDataDir uses the new paths package

title: Implement generic table CLI set command
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd009-cupboard-cli.yaml (R3.2 set command specification)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (R3 Table interface)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc004-generic-table-cli.yaml (S4-S6 success criteria for set)
- cmd/cupboard/get.go (pattern from get command, shared helpers)
- internal/sqlite/crumbs_table.go (Set behavior: empty ID creates, existing ID updates)

## Files to Create/Modify
- cmd/cupboard/set.go (create) — set command implementation
- cmd/cupboard/root.go (modify) — register set command

## Requirements
- Implement `cupboard set <table> <id> <json>` per prd009-cupboard-cli R3.2
- Accept table name, ID, and JSON payload as positional arguments (cobra.ExactArgs(3))
- Empty string ID ("") creates a new entity; non-empty ID updates existing
- Parse JSON payload into appropriate entity struct based on table name
- Call Table.Set(id, entity) and output the result as pretty-printed JSON
- Exit 1 with parse error details for invalid JSON
- Exit 1 with "unknown table" message for invalid table name
- Error messages to stderr

## Design Decisions
- Need a `parseEntityJSON(tableName string, data []byte) (any, error)` function that unmarshals JSON into the correct entity type (*types.Crumb, *types.Trail, etc.) based on table name
- Reuse attachBackend() helper from get command

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `cupboard set crumbs "" '{"Name":"Test","State":"draft"}'` creates crumb, returns JSON with CrumbID
- [ ] `cupboard set crumbs <id> <json>` updates existing crumb
- [ ] `cupboard set crumbs "" '{invalid}'` returns exit 1 with parse error
- [ ] `cupboard set unknown-table "" '{}'` returns exit 1 with valid table names
- [ ] Works across table types: crumbs, trails, links, properties, metadata, stashes
- [ ] Command registered in root.go init()

title: Integration tests for SQLite backend: Cupboard lifecycle and crumbs CRUD
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.0-uc001-cupboard-lifecycle.yaml (all test cases)
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.0-uc002-table-crud.yaml (all test cases)
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.0-uc003-crumb-lifecycle.yaml (all test cases)
- internal/sqlite/backend.go (SQLiteBackend)
- internal/sqlite/crumbs_table.go (crumbsTable)

## Files to Create/Modify
- tests/integration/test_rel01_0_uc001_cupboard_lifecycle_test.go (create) - Table-driven tests: Attach with valid config, Attach with invalid config, Detach idempotent, GetTable for all standard names, GetTable for unknown name, operations after Detach return ErrCupboardDetached
- tests/integration/test_rel01_0_uc002_table_crud_test.go (create) - Table-driven tests: Set creates crumb with UUID v7, Get retrieves by ID, Get returns ErrNotFound, Delete removes crumb, Delete cascades, Fetch with empty filter, Fetch with state filter, Fetch with limit/offset, JSONL persistence after Set/Delete
- tests/integration/test_rel01_0_uc003_crumb_lifecycle_test.go (create) - Table-driven tests: create draft crumb, transition through states, Pebble from taken, Pebble from non-taken fails, Dust from any state, persist and reload state

## Requirements
- Use t.TempDir() for DataDir isolation
- Each test creates a fresh SQLiteBackend, Attaches, runs test cases, Detaches
- Verify JSONL files are written correctly (read back and parse)
- Test JSONL roundtrip: Attach, write data, Detach, delete cupboard.db, re-Attach, verify data loaded from JSONL
- Use testify for assertions

## Design Decisions
- Integration tests in tests/integration/ per project layout
- Each test suite file maps to one use case YAML
- Table-driven tests with shared setup/teardown

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Cupboard lifecycle tests cover attach/detach/error paths
- [ ] CRUD tests cover all Table operations
- [ ] Crumb lifecycle tests cover state machine
- [ ] JSONL roundtrip test verifies data survives db deletion
- [ ] All tests pass: go test ./tests/integration/...
